data.title: Zoo TV Live In Dublin 1993 EP
data.text:
Not surprised itâ€™s not a full show. Oddly for such a renowned live band, there is no officially released (excluding fan club releases) live albums. There is no equivalent of Live n Dangerous or Too Late to Stop Now or Stop Making Sense. I donâ€™t see that changing anytime soon.

This is such an odd release. The cover is utterly predictable, the tracks uninspiring and the timing baffling.

Perhaps the new management demands product?

Cooler for me would have been an echo of Under a Blood Red Sky, an 8 track mini album to mark Zoo TV. The timing still makes no sense.

Side 1

Zoo Station

Until the End of The World

Stay (Faraway So Close)

Mysterious Ways

Side 2

The Fly

Running to Stand Still

With or Without You

Love is Blindness

Ok, nice to hear MW but it's not the Bootleg-Version with falsetto vocals at the end (what i really loved during MW in 1993). Is it reworked? Can't understand why they not release the great version of WOWY with the extra guitar solo at the end from the 1992 shows. Unfortunately overpriced for an EP but bought the Vinyl & CD anyway to have it in my collection. ðŸ™ˆ

Originally posted by cmaly:Grifting the "buy all the formats" completists. Drips and drabs. U2 is trolling its fans with this one.

How is this doing that exactly?

They haven't released this material before. And they announced all of the formats all on one day.

CD. 12-Inch yellow vinyl. Digital, including an Atmos version. Reasonable amount of formats for something like this. U2 fans have been crying for CD releases for some time, having not made the switch to vinyl.

Im really surprised that some people dare complaining that WE have unreleased material instead of a 40th remaster of the 28/8 show !!

This " bootleg" IS perfect, the best, and has already been remastered by brillant people here. No there IS not the fabulous falsetto, but listen to the bootleg and you'll hear it !!! And now WE have a New soundboard version of a MW unreleased date in an official release. This IS a great great news, Hope the 5 titles are from the 27th !!

Originally posted by u2wanderer1:[..]

How is this doing that exactly?

They haven't released this material before. And they announced all of the formats all on one day.

CD. 12-Inch yellow vinyl. Digital, including an Atmos version. Reasonable amount of formats for something like this. U2 fans have been crying for CD releases for some time, having not made the switch to vinyl.

Ignore him man. Between him and U2, seems to me heâ€™s the one trolling trying to stir the pot and ruffle the feathers.
